question_text: Which of the following are true characteristics of mesh networks used by some WISPs? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Each node can forward traffic to others
They require clear line-of-sight between all nodes
They increase redundancy and fault tolerance
They use coaxial cable for backbone links
correct_answer: Each node can forward traffic to others
They increase redundancy and fault tolerance
explanation: Mesh networks enable devices to relay traffic for one another, creating fault-tolerant paths without requiring direct line-of-sight between all nodes.
